body_html:
@pjh5, I will rebuild a conda environment from scratch. Can you confirm if one should follow:

Install with GPU Support==>For Ubuntu 16.04==>wget "http://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/cuda/repos/ubuntu1604/x86_64/**cuda-repo-ubuntu1604_8.0.61-1_amd64.deb**"
and
CUDNN_URL="http://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/redist/cudnn/**v5.1**/cudnn-8.0-linux-x64-v5.1.tgz"

This makes the combination cuda 8.0 - cudnn 5.1

Whereas my efforts so far have been via anaconda as:

conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda9.0-cudnn7 (as per https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=ubuntu&configuration=prebuilt)

Which would have led to combination of cuda 9.0 - cudnn 7.0

Please advice
